newsitem.title: USA: UAL's United passenger load factor rises.
newsitem.headline: UAL's United passenger load factor rises.

text.p: UAL Corp said Thursday its United Airlines posted a rise in total passenger load factor for April to 70.5 percent from 70.2 percent a year ago.
In North America, passenger load factor rose to 71.1 percent in April from 70.1 percent a year ago.
"We are pleased with our overall traffic performance for April," John Edwardson, president, said in a statement. "Our domestic passenger load factor increased a full point to 71.1 percent."

UAL said total scheduled available seat miles were 13.64 billion, up 4.5 percent from 13.06 billion a year ago. Domestic available seat miles were 8.53 billion, up three percent from 8.28 billion a year ago.
Revenue passenger miles in the month gained 4.8 percent to 9.62 billion from 9.17 billion.
Domestic revenue passenger miles totaled 6.07 billion, up 4.5 percent from 5.80 billion a year ago.
Year-to-date passenger load factor increased 0.9 percentage point to 70.0 percent from 69.1 percent.
